spec.name: La Fraternelle du Nord Building
spec.description: The La Fraternelle du Nord Building is a historical residential and commercial structure, completed between 1931 and 1932. It was designed by architect **Marcel Desmet**, known for his work in the Art Deco and Modernist styles of the Protectorate era. Located in the central district, this building reflects the multi-story apartment block typology that defined the city's new urban center, blending commercial functionality with residential use.

access.comment: Building is inhabited; exterior view is public, interior access is restricted to residents/tenants.
